text: Le Ga kɔkɔeawo me, amekɔnu ƒe kasaɖeɖeɖe wɔ nu si le noun la kple nu si wotsɔ ka eŋu (determinawo) le sentence me.
translation: In Ga lessons, a noun construction consists of a noun together with elements attached to it (determiners) in a sentence.

text: Determinawo le Ga me tsɔ gomeɖeɖe si wɔma amekɔnu la anya ne nyɛ kpɔkpɔɖeŋu alo gɔmeɖeɖe wɔ asɛm me.
translation: In Ga, determiners help show whether a noun is known or identifiable in context.

text: Le sukuwɔnu si wotsɔ fia le Ga kɔkɔeawo me la, determinawo te noun la megbe wɔ amekɔnu ƒe kasaɖeɖeɖe me.
translation: In the lesson examples, determiners occur after the noun in Ga noun constructions.

source.document: Rules of writing a Ghanaian language GA VERSION.pdf

text: Ga kɔkɔeawo kɔ demonstrative determinawo abe ‘lɛ’ alo ‘ni’ (abe nyɛkpɔɖeɖe) si wotsɔ kɔfia amekɔnu la le asɛm me.
translation: Ga lessons present demonstrative determiners such as ‘lɛ’ or ‘ni’ (as examples) used to point out a noun in context.

text: Le Ga sukuu kɔkɔeawo me, definite determinawo tsɔ gomeɖeɖe si amekɔnu la nya kpɔkpɔɖeŋu le asɛm me.
translation: In Ga school lessons, definite determiners indicate that the noun is already known in the context.
